ingredients: 1/2 cup milk (dairy, almond, or oat milk)
instructions: Rinse buckwheat groats thoroughly until water runs clear
In a dry skillet over medium heat, toast groats for 3-4 minutes, stirring constantly
Bring water or broth to a boil in a medium pot
Add toasted buckwheat and salt, reduce heat to low
Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes until water is absorbed
Remove from heat, let stand covered for 5 minutes
Fluff with a fork
Stir in butter and milk until creamy
Optional: add sugar or honey to taste
Optional: add black pepper
Optional: top with fried onions for extra flavor
Serve warm as a side dish or simple breakfast

ingredients: 2 cups Greek yogurt or plain yogurt
instructions: Spoon yogurt into serving bowls
Drizzle honey generously over the yogurt
Add vanilla extract and cinnamon if using, stir gently
Top with fresh berries
Optional: add granola for crunch
Optional: sprinkle with chopped nuts
Optional: garnish with fresh mint
Serve immediately
For meal prep: layer ingredients in jars, refrigerate for up to 3 days

ingredients: 30g beef tenderloin per bowl, very thinly sliced
instructions: Char onion and ginger over high heat until blackened on cut sides
Toast spices (star anise, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, coriander) in dry pan for 3 minutes
Rinse bones and brisket, cover with water, boil for 5 minutes, then drain and rinse
Bring 3.5 litres water to boil, add bones, brisket, charred onion and ginger, and toasted spices
Simmer covered for 3 hours
Remove brisket (it should be fall-apart tender), cool, then refrigerate for later use
Simmer remaining broth uncovered for 40 more minutes
Strain broth into another pot, discard bones and spices
Add fish sauce, adjust with sugar and salt if needed
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions
Place noodles in bowls, top with raw beef slices and brisket slices
Ladle hot broth over beef (it will cook to medium rare)
Serve with toppings on the side

breakfast.name: Buckwheat porridge with milk and berries

ingredients: 1 cup milk (dairy, almond, or oat milk)
1 cup fresh or frozen berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
Optional: nuts or seeds for topping
instructions: Rinse buckwheat groats thoroughly until water runs clear
In a medium pot, bring water and salt to a boil
Add buckwheat, reduce heat to low, cover
Simmer for 15-20 minutes until water is absorbed
Remove from heat, let stand covered for 5 minutes
Fluff with a fork
Stir in butter and milk until creamy
Add honey or maple syrup to taste
Optional: add cinnamon or vanilla
Top with fresh or frozen berries
Optional: add nuts or seeds
Serve warm

ingredients: Optional: 1-2 tbsp white sesame seeds for topping
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper
In a large bowl, beat softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy
Add egg yolk and vanilla extract, mix well
Sift together flour, matcha powder, and salt
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, mixing until just combined
Form dough into a log, wrap in plastic, and refrigerate for 30 minutes
Slice dough into 1/4 inch rounds
Optional: roll edges in sesame seeds or sprinkle with sugar
Place cookies on baking sheet, 2 inches apart
Bake for 10-12 minutes until edges are lightly golden
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to wire rack
Store in airtight container for up to 1 week

ingredients: 1 lb (450g) chicken thighs or breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 1 tbsp water
instructions: Cook rice according to package instructions
Make teriyaki sauce: combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar, honey, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger in a bowl
Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat
Add chicken pieces, cook 5-6 minutes until browned
Add teriyaki sauce to the pan
Bring to a simmer, cook 3-4 minutes
Stir in cornstarch mixture to thicken sauce
Continue cooking 1-2 minutes until sauce coats chicken
Remove from heat
Serve chicken and sauce over steamed rice
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions
Optional: serve with steamed broccoli or other vegetables

ingredients: Pickled vegetables (pickled carrots, daikon, or cabbage)
Salt and white pepper to taste
Optional: fried shallots, chili oil, cilantro
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear
In a large pot, bring broth, water, and ginger to a boil
Add rice, reduce heat to low
Simmer uncovered for 1-1.5 hours, stirring occasionally
Cook until rice breaks down and porridge reaches desired consistency
Add more water if needed for thinner consistency
Season with soy sauce, sesame oil, salt and white pepper
Prepare pickled vegetables on the side
Serve hot porridge garnished with chopped scallions
Serve pickled vegetables on the side
Optional: add fried shallots, chili oil, or cilantro as toppings

ingredients: 4 tbsp natural peanut butter (creamy or chunky)
Optional: chia seeds or granola for topping
instructions: Choose ripe but firm bananas (some brown spots are good)
Peel bananas and slice into rounds or leave whole for dipping
Place peanut butter in a small bowl for dipping or spread on banana slices
Optional: drizzle with honey for extra sweetness
Optional: sprinkle with cinnamon
Optional: top with chia seeds or granola for crunch
Serve immediately for best texture

ingredients: 1 lb (450g) beef sirloin or tenderloin, cut into strips
instructions: Season beef strips with salt and pepper
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over high heat, brown beef in batches, set aside
Add butter and remaining oil to the same pan
Sauté onion for 3-4 minutes until softened
Add mushrooms, cook 5-7 minutes until browned
Add garlic, cook 30 seconds until fragrant
Sprinkle flour over vegetables, stir for 1 minute
Optional: add white wine and let it reduce for 1 minute
Add beef broth, tomato paste, and Worcestershire sauce
Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens
Reduce heat to low, stir in sour cream and Dijon mustard
Add beef back to pan, heat through (do not boil after adding sour cream)
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve over cooked rice, garnish with fresh parsley

ingredients: Salt and white pepper to taste
Napa cabbage leaves or parchment paper
Optional: dipping sauce (soy sauce, vinegar, chili oil)
instructions: Make dough: place flour in a bowl, gradually add boiling water while stirring
Add cold water, knead until smooth dough forms
Cover and rest for 30 minutes
Make filling: combine pork, shrimp, bamboo shoots, green onions, soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, salt and pepper
Mix well, set aside
Divide dough into small balls, roll into thin circles
Place 1 tbsp filling in center of each wrapper
Pleat edges to seal (traditional technique)
Line steamer with cabbage leaves or parchment
Place dumplings in steamer, leaving space between
Steam for 8-10 minutes until cooked through
Serve hot with dipping sauce

ingredients: 2 apples (any variety - Granny Smith, Honeycrisp, Fuji)
4 oz (120g) cheese (cheddar, gouda, brie, or your favorite)
instructions: Wash apples thoroughly
Core apples and slice into wedges or rounds
Slice cheese into thin pieces or small cubes
Arrange apple slices on a serving plate or board
Place cheese alongside or on top of apple slices
Optional: drizzle with honey
Optional: sprinkle with chopped nuts and cinnamon
Serve immediately for best freshness

ingredients: 2 tbsp tomato paste or 1 cup tomato juice
Optional: 1/2 cup cooked beef or sausage
instructions: Heat butter or oil in a large pot over medium heat
Sauté onion until softened, 5 minutes
Add carrot, cook 3 more minutes
Add garlic, cook 30 seconds
Add tomato paste, cook 1 minute
Add broth, beets, potato, and sugar
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer 20 minutes
Add cabbage and vinegar, cook 10 more minutes until vegetables are tender
Optional: add cooked beef or sausage
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Ladle into bowls
Top with a generous dollop of sour cream
Garnish with fresh dill
Serve hot with crusty bread
